intro: Cochlearia crantzii, commonly known as the Norwegian mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to northern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in alpine or coastal areas. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are white or pale purple. It is a short-lived perennial that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
